A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Disney made it clear pretty soon that this movie was all about women.
It is really in your face. They did not even try to hide it.
Look at that giant bleeding vagina in the poster\, complete with clitoris hooded Luke. 
It is\, literally\, a "free bleeding feminism" manifesto. Google it. That movement is real.
The cannon aimed at the gate from which red rivulets emanate\, is an all too clear metaphor of male sexual violence against women.
Kylo Ren appearing shirtless to Rey was a clear attempt to hint at him sexually harassing her. Her reaction is very revealing.
It's not a joke. They used the STAR WARS appeal to lure people (especially males) into the theaters in order to lecture them about female supremacy\, male ineptitude\, evil nature and violent attitude toward women.

The real title of this movie is Star Wars - #MeToo
